description:
Lutron’s Caséta family of smart lighting controls is one of the best smart home systems on the marke. These products are also compatible with a huge number of other smart home ecosystems. Caséta and Caséta Diva dimmers, switches, and other devices work with everything from Apple’s HomeKit to Sonos multi-room audio systems. That makes it easy to overlook the fact that they’re not Matter certified (this despite Lutron’s having a seat on Connectivity Standards Alliance’s board of directors).

We rarely see Caséta and Caséta Diva products go on sale, but Amazon has knocked 15- to 20 percent off a passel of dimmers and starter kits that include Lutron’s Smart Hub. You’ll find both the OG Caséta and the newer-style Caséta Diva form factors here. Homeowners who already have the required Caséta Smart Hub will find some add-on deals as well.
title: Lutron Caséta lighting controls discounted 20% for Black Friday

description:
Amazon Haul is Amazon’s back shelves: You’ll find random items, with a lot of junk mixed in with some gems. If you’re looking for suggestions to fill the stocking of the nerd you love, think about these.

One of the big caveats, of course, is that shipping isn’t free. You’ll need to buy a certain amount — usually $25 or so — to unlock free shipping. So while you can certainly create your own gift bag of random tech goodies, you can also use this list to fill out a list that just needs an item or two to get it over the top. Check out our list of the best Black Friday deals for more ideas.

Without further ado, our suggestions. Note that we certainly haven’t tested any of this ourselves, but they all seem to have positive rankings by Amazon shoppers.

Bonus: This list’s items totale
title: Believe it! I found some cool, cheap Black Friday gems for nerds on Amazon Haul

description:
Black Friday offers some great discounts on just about everything, but you have to hunt for the real deals. The wheat among the chaff, the gold among the dross. The little dark rye chips among the Chex Mix. That goes double for the Amazon Renewed Store, where refurbished goods go for even bigger discounts. But I found ’em.

Here are 10 great refurbished laptops, monitors, and other PC accessories that I spotted on Black Friday. Please keep in mind that, because these are refurbished (“renewed” according to Amazon) goods, they’re far more limited in stock than regular sale items, so they might disappear quickly. Amazon Renewed items come with a 90-day warranty, but some “Premium” items get a 365-day return period.
title: I found 10 great refurbished Black Friday deals from the Amazon Renewed Store

description:
Gamers of all stripes freaked out when Microsoft jacked up prices on its Game Pass subscription by 50 percent two months ago — which is why it’s terrific that Amazon is ignoring Microsoft’s demands and selling Game Pass Ultimate at the “old” price of $59.99 for a three-month code.

For me, the three-month Game Pass Ultimate deal for $59.99 is the big one: It covers both the Xbox and the PC, and gives you the most access to the most games. There was a huge outrage when Microsoft jacked up its Game Pass prices, but this feels a bit like the
title: Amazon is selling Xbox Game Pass Ultimate at the old cheap price

description:
Some security cameras are better at giving you a big-picture view, others excel with the finer details. This dual-lens Eufy cam, however, gives you the best of both worlds, and it’s getting a sweet half-off deal for Black Friday. 

On sale for $79.98, the Eufy Security Indoor Cam S350 becomes even cheaper when you clip the $10 coupon, bringing its final price down to $69.98. That’s good for 50-percent off the camera’s $139.99 list price. 

The Eufy Indoor Cam S350 arrives with dual cameras: one with a 4K wide-angle lens and a 130-degree field of view, while the other sports a 2K telephoto lens with 8K “hybrid” zoom (think 3x optical zoom combined with 8x digital zoom). Together, the two cameras work together for scanning large areas of your propert
title: Black Friday deal: This dual-lens security camera sees all for 50% off

description:
Black Friday is one of the only times you can score good savings on a VPN service throughout the year, and right now ExpressVPN has a deal that can’t be missed. One of our top VPNs overall, ExpressVPN is offering huge discounts of up to 81 percent off on its 12-month or 2-year plans.

Currently, its Basic plan which comes with access to the all-star VPN is only $3.49 per month for the first year, or $2.44 per month for two years. The Advanced plan which comes with the VPN plus ad- and tracker-blocking, a password manager, and Identity Defender anti-theft tools is discounted to $4.19 per month for the first year or $3.14 per month for two years — a staggering 30 percent cheaper than its usual price. title: ExpressVPN is the cheapest it’s ever been thanks to this Black Friday 2025 deal

description:

The good news is that both the Nvidia Shield and the Nvidia Shield Pro are getting Black Friday price drops this year—not huge price drops, mind you, but if you’ve been waiting for a Nvidia Shield discount, it’ll likely be a while before you see another. 

The standard Nvidia Shield is now selling for $124.99 at Amazon, a 17-percent discount versus its usual $149.99, while the Nvidia Shield Pro is going for $169.99, al
title: Nvidia’s Shield streaming players join the Black Friday party

description:
LG’s Ultragear 45GX900A-B OLED monitor is designed for gaming from the ground up, with a massive 45-inch ultrawide panel that won’t destroy your framerate thanks to some clever panel work. Normally $1,700, today you can get it new from eBay for just $799.99. That’s as much as you would have paid for a 27-inch OLED a couple of years ago.

At 45 inches diagonally, this monitor is almost as big as the biggest OLEDs on the market. But with a semi-standard 21:9 aspect ratio and a 3440×1440 resolution, it’s actually driving the same amount of pixels as most 34-inch screens. So while you won’t get the amazing density of a 4K or double-1440p monitor, like this one, you’ll be able to hit its maximum 240Hz refresh rate without absolutely crushing your gaming PC. It’s an excellent “sweet spot” if you’re look
title: Save $900 on this 45-inch LG ultrawide gaming OLED monitor

description: If you’re looking for a Chromebook that’s a touch fancier than your standard fare, you’ve come to the right spot. That’s $100 off for a model with a high-refresh-rate touchscreen, a 2-in-1 form factor,  and a zippy MediaTek Kompanio Ultra processor.
title: Get PCWorld’s top high-end Chromebook pick for $100 off right now

description:

Here’s the hidden detail about Govee’s Christmas Lights Set that you may have missed: it’s a two-for-one deal for Black Friday, meaning if you buy the first kit for $299.99–a 25 percent savings–you get the second bundle for free, good for a total savings of 50 percent off. 

Just add two of the Govee lights kids to your Amazon cart and you’ll see the savings upon checkout. 

The Govee Christmas Lights Set includes a 96-foot string of Govee’s Outdoor String Lights 2, a 100-foot set of Permanen

description: If you’re going to get an uber-fast USB-C charger this Black Friday, make it one that’s powerful enough to use with your laptop as well. That’s a new low price for it—and it’s understandably selling out fast. It even comes with a fast 240W USB-C cable, sweetening the deal further!

description:
Portable monitors are great, as we’ve discussed. And an OLED panel is a fantastic upgrade, for either a laptop screen or a monitor. So, why not combine the two? The answer is “because it’s expensive” — portable OLED monitors can cost double or triple the price of a standard USB-C-powered model. But Amazon is offering one for just $94.99 on Black Friday.

This is a fairly typical portable screen, aside from that fantastic OLED upgrade. At 13.3 inches and just .2 inches thin, it’s eminently portable, with a built-in kickstand that’s a little more sturdy than most of the combination stand/cases in these designs. I appreciate the dual USB-

description:
If you work across time zones or have relatives or friends overseas, one thing you can do in Windows 11 is set up additional clocks for those time zones to easily tell the time where you are. Setting up additional clocks puts those clocks in the System tray for quick viewing. Here’s how you do it.

What to do:

  • Right click on the clock in the bottom right corner of the screen and select Adjust date and time.
  • Expand the “Show time and date in the System tray” box. You should see two additional clocks listed.
  • Click on Change next to one of the clocks and choose a time zone from the drop-down list. Type in a name for your clock.
  • Click the box for “Show seconds in the system tray clock“ if you wish to see the se
title: How to set up additional clocks in Windows 11

description:
Welp. A dark time for tech enthusiasts is indeed inbound. As reported by my colleague Mark Hachman, it’s not just that Black Friday 2025 may be the last chance for us to get cheap PC deals.

Nope, the market is chaotic overall, as analyst Jon Peddie notes. GPU shipments have slowed. Prominent pre-built PC vendor CyberPower has confirmed it will raise prices after Black Friday. Laptop maker
title: The PC tech apocalypse may be nigh. But I’m still grateful

description:
I enjoy hunting for deals during Black Friday. I specifically like poking around for solid PC parts that I can combine for high-quality-but-affordable gaming PCs. I love it so much that I’ve sat down every year since 2016 to write up my findings—and over the last nine years, I combo-chained well enough to help others save hundreds on their 1080p and 1440p builds.

Y’all. This year is grim.

Sky-high RAM prices (which continue to climb) are obviously a major factor. But the effects of this year’s US tariffs also show clearly in the thin spread of discounts. You can still find good deals—but getting them to coalesce into a single computer will be extremely hard.

For select gamers, hope still is out there for now. I think these results paint a clear picture of where we’re at and what we can expect for 2026.
title: I crafted the cheapest Black Friday gaming PC build again. It’s brutal this year

description: If you have many big files (or a bazillion small files), finding enough affordable storage can be hard. description:
Millions of videos, from old camcorder recordings and compressed social media clips to dim indoor recordings, screen captures, gaming videos, and 720p AI-generated content, share the same problems: noise, blur, muted color, and limited resolution. In the past months, Aiarty Video Enhancer has helped millions of video creators tackle these issues with models built specifically for real-world footage.

Now, Aiarty Video Enhancer V3.0 introduces SDR-to-HDR conversion, faster AI processing modes, and expanded fine-tuning controls. This makes Aiarty a more practical AI video enhancement tool for both casual users and video professionals seeking high-quality results without a complicated workflow.

Aiarty Video Enhancer V3.0 is now available at
title: Aiarty Video Enhancer V3.0: Restore, Enhance, and Now Convert SDR to HDR

description:
Black Friday may be here, but the very best tech deals won’t hang around for long, and new sales will pop up throughout the day. PCWorld editors are keeping tabs on the best PC and tech deals across the web, making sure you don’t miss the top Amazon Lightning deals or inadvertently purchase a dud.

Brad Chacos and Alaina Yee — two veteran bargain hunters from our Full Nerd podcast — will be blogging about the juiciest Black Friday tech deals right here from 6 a.m. until 3 p.m. Eastern, drawing on literal decades of deep PC hardware and software experience to highlight the deals that are actually worth your hard-earned cash. Maybe we’ll add some board games or other geeky doo-dads into the mix too. We’re hungover on turkey, let’s have fun!

Stay tuned to our live blog for real-time u

The truth is: it doesn’t have to be.

title: Windows 11 Pro dropped from $199 to $9.97 for Black Friday

description:
Airflow is critical in a PC tower, so you need the right tower to provide it. This Black Friday you can get that in the Hyte Y40 S-tier Aesthetic PC case which has had its price slashed from $130 to $99.97 on Amazon. That’s a big price reduction of 23 percent.

The Y40 is a big ATX case designed to wow its owner. Its design is something else. Every edge is adorned in tightly controlled beveling for S-tier aesthetics with 2-piece glass to allow you to grab a glimpse at your PC’s performance.

The Y40 expands GPU support to 4 full slots with additional airflow space between the edge of the card and the glass.

This awesome case comes with 2 x 120mm fans pre-installed to cool down your precious PC components and keep your PC performing in tip top shape. One is located beneath th
title: The fantastic Hyte Y40 gaming case is only $99 this Black Friday

description:
Wrist problems from repetitive strain injury can creep up on you. One minute your wrist feels fine, then the next you’re in agony. That’s why it pays to think about your mouse and wrist before the worst happens.

This Black Friday you can do that with the Logitech MX Vertical Wireless mouse. It’s on sale, currently marked down by 19 percent to $97.49.

The Logitech MX Vertical is no ordinary mouse. It features an ergonomic design in a vertical orientation to take pressure off your wrist. The mouse angles your wrist in a natural handshake position that reduces muscular activity by 10 percent compared to a standard mouse.

Your hand gets angled up at a 57-degree vertical angle that reduces the pressure on your wrist. All the while, your thumb stays positioned comfortably on the mou
title: Grab Logitech’s MX Vertical Wireless mouse for 19% off. Your wrists will thank you

description:

This speedy mini PC isn’t trading price for value either. It comes with a powerful AMD Ryzen 7 6800H processor with clock speeds up to 4.7 GHz. That’s powerful enough to tear through everyday work and some basic gaming alike. Forget meager memory — this mini PC comes with 32GB of DDR5 RAM running at 4800MHz. It also features a full 1TB NVMe SSD for storing everything you need. This is a loaded mini PC for the price! The RAM is expandable to 64GB and the SSD is expandable too.

title: This loaded Ryzen 7 mini PC with 32GB RAM is a ludicrous $399 for Black Friday

description:
If you’ve been thinking about starting a live stream but don’t have a microphone yet, the Black Friday sales have a deal too good to refuse. Right now, you can buy the Logitech G Yeti GX Dynamic RGB Gaming Microphone for just $129.99, that’s down 24 percent on the usual price of $170.

The Logitech G Yeti GX Dynamic RGB Gaming Microphone is explicitly designed for game streamers. It combines a custom dynamic capsule with advanced software and is compatible with Windows or Mac.

The USB microphone rejects noise and key clicks to improve your sound and ensures consistent voice pick up. It produces high-quality audio when you stream.

There’re no chunky microphone parts in this device. It features a sleek, clean aesthetic that doesn’t take up much space on your desk.

description:
Every now and then a deal pops up on Amazon that’s so good it leaves us speechless. This deal on an Asus TUF Gaming monitor is just one of those deals, and if you’re a gamer you’re going to really want to take note. It’s been reduced by 42 percent, down from $139 to only $79.99. That’s right, it’s now only $79.99!

The monitor measures 24-inches and is Full HD (1920 x 1080p) resolution. A quick 144Hz refresh rate can be overclocked to 146Hz. That means all your gaming action will be buttery smooth on the panel. That’s the same refresh rate as the professional gamers use.

It features enhanced connectivity including HDMI 2.0 and DisplayPort 1.2 so it’s compatible with a wide variety of input sources.

title: A fast Asus 144Hz gaming monitor for $79? Now that’s a Black Friday steal!
